page.title: 02POPULATION OF HOUSTON
page.content: Until the 20th. century the area had less than{1000 people.}Most people worked in agriculture or in the Houston cotton mill. The village started to grow as road and rail links started to improve. New services in the village, for example, new public houses, schools, churches were justified by a growing population. Since 1971 there has been a rapid growth due to an influx of people to the many new housing estates built around the original village. The population had risen to{over 3000}by 1981. {Gryffe High School was opened in 1980. The village now covers a much larger area than before. There will be an estimated{6000 people by 1990}and the village boundaries by then will be close to the town of Linwood.
